text_content.paragraph: Use saved searches to rerun a search without having to reenter all the parameters each time. For example you can save a search for production levels, plugged wells this week, or wells spud (date you begin to drill a well) in the last year.
The demonstration below describes the steps to save a search, run a saved search and delete or rename a search. Select Play to view the demonstration.

cc_text.paragraph: Use saved searches to rerun a search without having to reenter all the parameters each time. Select Play to view the demonstration.
Once the results display in the Data Grid, click Add to Saved Searches. The Add Search dialog box opens.
Enter a descriptive name, in the search name field.
Click OK. The Haskell_1 search displays in My Saved Searches.
To run a saved search, expand the My Saved Searches in the Search Criteria Pane, if it’s collapsed.
Click the search’s name and the results display in the Data Grid.
To rename a saved search, place your cursor over the name of the saved search.
Search edit tools appear to the right of the search’s name. The buttons allow you to 1. Email the search, 2. Rename the search, and 3. Delete the search.
Click the Rename Search button. The Enter the Name for the View popup window displays.
Enter a new name, in the search name field.
Click OK. The Haskell search displays in My Saved Searches.
To delete a saved search, place your cursor over the name of the saved search. Search edit tools appear to the right of the search’s name.
Click the Delete Search button. The saved Search disappears from My Saved Searches.
